info.name: Segments Service
info.description: A microservice that provides access to segments.

item.name: Retrieves a single segment by ID

url.raw: {{baseUrl}}/1.0/analytics/services/segments/:id?locale=en_US&expansion=quickSegment,migratedIds&toBeUsedInRsid=cillum exercitation dolore pari&companyId=cillum exercitation dolore pari

query.description: Locale
Comma-delimited list of additional segment metadata fields to include on response.
Evaluate the reportTimeAttribution/customerJourney compatibility for the provided report suite ID
Filter list for the companyId

request.description:
A segment response will always include these default items:
id,name,description,rsid,owner

Other attributes can be optionally requested through the 'expansion' field:
modified: Date that the segment was last modified (ISO 8601)
definition: Segment definition as JSON object
compatibility: Products that the segment is compatible with
legacyId: Legacy segment ID from old segment database (only exists if the segment was migrated from the old segment DB)
isDeleted: Returns whether or not the segment is 'Deleted' (note that deleted segments are only returned if requested by ID)

response.name: successful operation

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: apikey

item.name: Make changes or updates to an existing segment

query.description: Comma-delimited list of additional segment metadata fields to include on response.
Locale
The login of the user that the operation should be logged against
update modified and modifiedById fields

request.description:
The following fields can be modified through this endpoint:
name, description, definition, owner, rsid, aamStatus

Note: "aamStatus" is used to "publish" a report suite segment to other products in the Experience Cloud. Description is always required when publishing with aamStatus. The report suite must already be pre-configured for AAM for publishing to succeed (see the "/segments/aamStatus/" endpoint for more information).
Format for aamStatus object:
"aamStatus":{"published":["rsid1","rsid2"]}

Example "defintion" for use in testing API below ("Page exists"):
"definition":{"func":"segment","container":{"func":"container","context":"hits","pred":{"func":"exists","description":"Page","val":{"func":"attr","name":"variables/page"}}},"version":[1,0,0]}

Response will be the newly modified segment object after the update request completes.

SegmentResponse
A segment response will always include these default items:
id,name,description,rsid,owner

Other attributes can be optionally requested through the 'expansion' field:
modified: Date that the segment was last modified (ISO 8601)
definition: Segment definition as JSON object
compatibility: Products that the segment is compatible with
legacyId: Legacy segment ID from old segment database (only exists if the segment was migrated from the old segment DB)
isDeleted: Returns whether or not the segment is 'Deleted' (note that deleted segments are only returned if requested by ID)

response.name: successful operation

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: apikey

response.name: Definition must be formatted as a JSON Object

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: apikey

response.name: Company mismatch; segment ownership can only be transferred within the same organization

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: apikey

response.name: User does not have permission to update this segment

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: apikey

response.name: External API error; Segment update or retrieval failed

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: apikey

Property to sort by (name, modified_date, published, publishedDate, performanceScore and id are currently allowed)

query.description: Comma-delimited list of additional segment metadata fields to include on response.
Locale
The login of the user that the operation should be logged against

request.description:
Creates a new segment. The following attributes are available when creating a segment:
Required: name, definition, rsid
Optional: description, aamStatus

Note: "aamStatus" is used to "publish" a report suite segment to other products in the Experience Cloud. Description is always required when publishing with aamStatus. The report suite must already be pre-configured for AAM for publishing to succeed (see the "/segments/aamStatus/" endpoint for more information).
Format for aamStatus object:
"aamStatus":{"published":["rsid1","rsid2"]}

Example definition for use in testing API below ("Page exists"):
"definition":{"func":"segment","container":{"func":"container","context":"hits","pred":{"func":"exists","description":"Page","val":{"func":"attr","name":"variables/page"}}},"version":[1,0,0]}

SegmentResponse
A segment response will always include these default items:
id,name,description,rsid,owner

Other attributes can be optionally requested through the 'expansion' field:
modified: Date that the segment was last modified (ISO 8601)
definition: Segment definition as JSON object
compatibility: Products that the segment is compatible with
legacyId: Legacy segment ID from old segment database (only exists if the segment was migrated from the old segment DB)
isDeleted: Returns whether or not the segment is 'Deleted' (note that deleted segments are only returned if requested by ID)

response.name: successful operation

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: apikey

response.name: Invalid input; name, rsid, and definition are all required. Definition must be formatted as a JSON Object.

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: apikey

response.name: External API error; Segment create or retrieval failed

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: apikey

item.name: Returns a segment validation for the segment contained in the post body of the report.

request.description:
The segment object being sent in contains the rsid and the segment definition. Used to validate a segment definition.

The response contains products that the definition is compatible with.

Example definition for use in testing API below ("Page exists"):
{"func":"segment","container":{"func":"container","context":"hits","pred":{"func":"exists","description":"Page","val":{"func":"attr","name":"variables/page"}}},"version":[1,0,0]}

response.name: successful operation

item.name: Retrieves a single segment by ID

query.description: The report suite where the segment is intended to be used.  This report suite will be used to determine things like compatibility and permissions.
Locale
Comma-delimited list of additional segment metadata fields to include on response.
The login of the user that the operation should be logged against

request.description:
A segment response will always include these default items:
id

Other attributes can be optionally requested through the 'expansion' field:
name: Name of the segment
description: Description of the segment
dataId: Associated Data ID of the segment
owner: Owner of the segment
modified: Date that the segment was last modified (ISO 8601)
definition: Segment definition as JSON object
compatibility: Products that the segment is compatible with
quickSegment: Quick segments are internal segments that can be created quickly from the Workspace and used immediately
isDeleted: Returns whether or not the segment is 'Deleted' (note that deleted segments are only returned if requested by ID)

response.name: successful operation

item.name: Make changes or updates to an existing segment

query.description: Comma-delimited list of additional segment metadata fields to include on response.
Locale
The login of the user that the operation should be logged against
Use cached results

request.description:
The following fields can be modified through this endpoint:
name, description, definition, owner, rsid, aamStatus

Note: "aamStatus" is used to "publish" a report suite segment to other products in the Experience Cloud. Description is always required when publishing with aamStatus. The report suite must already be pre-configured for AAM for publishing to succeed (see the "/segments/aamStatus/" endpoint for more information).
Format for aamStatus object:
"aamStatus":{"published":["rsid1","rsid2"]}

Example "defintion" for use in testing API below ("Page exists"):
"definition":{"func":"segment","container":{"func":"container","context":"hits","pred":{"func":"exists","description":"Page","val":{"func":"attr","name":"variables/page"}}},"version":[1,0,0]}

Response will be the newly modified segment object after the update request completes.

SegmentResponse
A segment response will always include these default items:
id

Other attributes can be optionally requested through the 'expansion' field:
name: Name of the segment
description: Description of the segment
dataId: Associated Data ID of the segment
owner: Owner of the segment
modified: Date that the segment was last modified (ISO 8601)
definition: Segment definition as JSON object
compatibility: Products that the segment is compatible with
quickSegment: Quick segments are internal segments that can be created quickly from the Workspace and used immediately
isDeleted: Returns whether or not the segment is 'Deleted' (note that deleted segments are only returned if requested by ID)

request.description:
Creates a new segment. The following attributes are available when creating a segment:
Required: name, definition, dataId
Example definition for use in testing API below ("Page exists"):
"definition":{"func":"segment","container":{"func":"container","context":"hits","pred":{"func":"exists","description":"Page","val":{"func":"attr","name":"variables/page"}}},"version":[1,0,0]}

SegmentResponse
A segment response will always include these default items:
id

Other attributes can be optionally requested through the 'expansion' field:
name: Name of the segment
description: Description of the segment
dataId: Associated Data ID of the segment
owner: Owner of the segment
modified: Date that the segment was last modified (ISO 8601)
definition: Segment definition as JSON object
compatibility: Products that the segment is compatible with
quickSegment: Quick segments are internal segments that can be created quickly from the Workspace and used immediately
isDeleted: Returns whether or not the segment is 'Deleted' (note that deleted segments are only returned if requested by ID)

request.description:
The segment object being sent in contains the rsid and the segment definition. Used to validate a segment definition.

The response contains products that the definition is compatible with.

Example definition for use in testing API below ("Page exists"):
{"func":"segment","container":{"func":"container","context":"hits","pred":{"func":"exists","description":"Page","val":{"func":"attr","name":"variables/page"}}},"version":[1,0,0]}

Comma-delimited list of additional segment metadata fields to include on response.
Include additional segments not owned by user. The "all" option takes precedence over "shared"
Include additional segments not owned by user. The "all" option takes precedence over "shared"
Filter list to only include segments tied to specified RSID list (comma-delimited)
Filter list to only include segments compatible with the specified product
Filter list to only include segments owned by the specified loginId
Filter list to only include segments in the specified list (comma-delimited list of IDs). This has filtered Ids from tags, approved, favorites and user specified Ids list.
Required when reportTimeAttribution != null or expansion=reportTimeAttribution
Filter list to only include segments in the specified list(comma-delimited list of IDs). This has the segment Ids from shares.
Filter list to only include segments by reportTimeAttribution
Locale
Filter list to only include segments that contains the Name
Filter list to only include segments modified since this date (ISO8601 format)
Filter list to only include segments with the given data group
Filter list to only include segments where the published field is set to one of the allowable values (all, true, false).

query.description: Comma-delimited list of additional segment metadata fields to include on response.
Locale
Use cached results

request.description:
Creates a new segment. The following attributes are available when creating a segment:
Required: name, definition, dataId
Example definition for use in testing API below ("Page exists"):
"definition":{"func":"segment","container":{"func":"container","context":"hits","pred":{"func":"exists","description":"Page","val":{"func":"attr","name":"variables/page"}}},"version":[1,0,0]}

SegmentResponse
A segment response will always include these default items:
id

Other attributes can be optionally requested through the 'expansion' field:
name: Name of the segment
description: Description of the segment
dataId: Associated Data ID of the segment
owner: Owner of the segment
modified: Date that the segment was last modified (ISO 8601)
definition: Segment definition as JSON object
compatibility: Products that the segment is compatible with
quickSegment: Quick segments are internal segments that can be created quickly from the Workspace and used immediately
isDeleted: Returns whether or not the segment is 'Deleted' (note that deleted segments are only returned if requested by ID)

response.name: successful operation

query.description: The segment ID to compute performance score on

request.description:
Returns a segment performance score for either the segment id or the segment contained in the post body of the report.

Example definition for use in testing API below ("Page exists"):
{"func":"segment","container":{"func":"container","context":"hits","pred":{"func":"exists","description":"Page","val":{"func":"attr","name":"variables/page"}}},"version":[1,0,0]}
